meta.ip: This account tells about a prophet named Yonah (Jonah) who lived in Israel of north, around 250 years before David became king. This account is not like other prophetic accounts because it tells us about the neula-ula of one prophet ware obeyed of commanded of God kandin egpeendiyeen of city of Nineveh. Ware he obeyed of commanded kandin because nakataha he not egbulusan of God of punishing the that city ke eg-inniyug the people of sins dan. But due to kein-inuwan natamanan din, napehes he went of Nineveh and migpangguhud of igpahuhud kandin of God. Nataman, neenenduenan he and nasakitan from because ware indeed natuman the said rin there to people punished of God the their place.

Told also of this document egpalintutuu of God the all made rin like water, ngalap, wind and other pad. But greatest of all, told here hiid‑uwen the God and large the love rin, because even the enemy of his people, impasaylu rin and inluwas din of mig-inniyug e them of sins dan.

contents: Now Yahweh said to Yonah the son of Amittai,
contents.verseText: Now Yahweh said to Yonah the son of Amittai,

contents: “Go now to the major city of Nineveh, and speak out against it because I've noticed how evil they are.”
contents.verseText: “Go now to the major city of Nineveh, and speak out against it because I've noticed how evil they are.”

contents: But Yonah decided to run away from Yahweh so he went down to Yoppa and found a ship about to go to Tarshish. He paid the fare and went aboard to go with them to Tarshish to get away from Yahweh.
contents.verseText: But Yonah decided to run away from Yahweh so he went down to Yoppa and found a ship about to go to Tarshish. He paid the fare and went aboard to go with them to Tarshish to get away from Yahweh.

contents: However Yahweh caused a strong wind on the sea and it became a such big storm that they all thought the ship would disintegrate.
contents.verseText: However Yahweh caused a strong wind on the sea and it became a such big storm that they all thought the ship would disintegrate.

contents: The sailors were afraid and they each cried to their own gods for help, and they threw the cargo overboard to make the ship lighter. But Yonah had gone down into the hold where he had laid down and fallen fast asleep.
contents.verseText: The sailors were afraid and they each cried to their own gods for help, and they threw the cargo overboard to make the ship lighter. But Yonah had gone down into the hold where he had laid down and fallen fast asleep.

contents: So the ship's captain approached him and said, “Why are you sleeping? Come on, pray to your God and perhaps he will take notice of us so we won't die.”
contents.verseText: So the ship's captain approached him and said, “Why are you sleeping? Come on, pray to your God and perhaps he will take notice of us so we won't die.”

contents: Then the sailors said to each other, “Let's draw straws to find out whose fault it is that we are in this predicament.” So they drew straws and Yonah was indicated.
contents.verseText: Then the sailors said to each other, “Let's draw straws to find out whose fault it is that we are in this predicament.” So they drew straws and Yonah was indicated.

contents: So they said to him, “Hey, tell us why this disaster is happening to us. What is your occupation? Where are you from? What country? What nationality are you?”
contents.verseText: So they said to him, “Hey, tell us why this disaster is happening to us. What is your occupation? Where are you from? What country? What nationality are you?”

contents: And he said to them, “I'm a Hebrew and I fear Yahweh the God of the heavens who made the sea and the land.”
contents.verseText: And he said to them, “I'm a Hebrew and I fear Yahweh the God of the heavens who made the sea and the land.”

contents: And the men became really scared and asked him what he had done, because he had told them that he was running from Yahweh.
contents.verseText: And the men became really scared and asked him what he had done, because he had told them that he was running from Yahweh.

contents: So they asked him what they should do to him so that the sea would calm, because the storm was getting worse.
contents.verseText: So they asked him what they should do to him so that the sea would calm, because the storm was getting worse.

contents: And he said to them, “Pick me up and throw me into the sea so that the sea will calm down because I know that this terrible storm came because of me.”
contents.verseText: And he said to them, “Pick me up and throw me into the sea so that the sea will calm down because I know that this terrible storm came because of me.”

contents: However, the men tried to row but they were not able to return to the land because the sea was very rough and getting worse.
contents.verseText: However, the men tried to row but they were not able to return to the land because the sea was very rough and getting worse.

contents: So they called to Yahweh and said, “We beg you Yahweh: please don't let us die because of this man, and don't consider us guilty because you yourself have made this happen.”
contents.verseText: So they called to Yahweh and said, “We beg you Yahweh: please don't let us die because of this man, and don't consider us guilty because you yourself have made this happen.”

contents: And then they picked up Yonah and threw him into the sea, and the sea became calm.
contents.verseText: And then they picked up Yonah and threw him into the sea, and the sea became calm.

contents: The men felt really scared of Yahweh and they sacrificed to him and made vows.

contents: Then Yahweh commanded a huge fish to swallow Yonah and he stayed in the belly of the fish for three days and three nights.
contents.verseText: Then Yahweh commanded a huge fish to swallow Yonah and he stayed in the belly of the fish for three days and three nights.

contents: And Yonah prayed to Yahweh his God from the belly of the fish.
contents.verseText: And Yonah prayed to Yahweh his God from the belly of the fish.

contents: And he said,

contents.q1: “I called to you Yahweh in my distress and you answered me. I cried for help from the valley of death and you heard my voice.

contents.verseText: And he said, “I called to you Yahweh in my distress and you answered me. I cried for help from the valley of death and you heard my voice.

contents: You have thrown me right into the deep—the heart of the sea; and a flood surrounds me. All your waves are crashing over me.
contents.verseText: You have thrown me right into the deep—the heart of the sea; and a flood surrounds me. All your waves are crashing over me.

contents: And I said, ‘I have been driven out of your sight however I will look again towards your holy temple.’
contents.verseText: And I said, ‘I have been driven out of your sight however I will look again towards your holy temple.’

contents: I was up to my neck in the waters; it was deep all around me. There were reeds wrapped around my head.
contents.verseText: I was up to my neck in the waters; it was deep all around me. There were reeds wrapped around my head.

contents: I went down to the foundations of the mountains; barred from returning to the land. But you saved my life from the grave, Yahweh my God.
contents.verseText: I went down to the foundations of the mountains; barred from returning to the land. But you saved my life from the grave, Yahweh my God.

contents: When my life was draining away from me, I remembered you, Yahweh, and my prayer reached you in your holy temple.
contents.verseText: When my life was draining away from me, I remembered you, Yahweh, and my prayer reached you in your holy temple.

contents: Those who worship lifeless gods abandon their allegiance to you.
contents.verseText: Those who worship lifeless gods abandon their allegiance to you.

contents: But I'll speak out my gratitude as I sacrifice to you. I've vowed this and I'll do it, because Yahweh is my rescuer.”
contents.verseText: But I'll speak out my gratitude as I sacrifice to you. I've vowed this and I'll do it, because Yahweh is my rescuer.”

contents: Then Yahweh spoke to the fish and it vomitted Yonah up onto the land.
contents.verseText: Then Yahweh spoke to the fish and it vomitted Yonah up onto the land.

contents: And Yahweh spoke to Yonah a second time saying,
contents.verseText: And Yahweh spoke to Yonah a second time saying,

contents: “Go now to the major city, Nineveh, and announce this declaration which I've told you.”
contents.verseText: “Go now to the major city, Nineveh, and announce this declaration which I've told you.”

contents: So Yonah went directly to Nineveh. It was a large city, taking three days to travel across.
contents.verseText: So Yonah went directly to Nineveh. It was a large city, taking three days to travel across.

contents: Yonah went one day's travel into the city and publicly announced, “Nineveh is going to be destroyed in forty days!”
contents.verseText: Yonah went one day's travel into the city and publicly announced, “Nineveh is going to be destroyed in forty days!”

contents: The people of Nineveh believed in God and announced a time of fasting, and from the least to the most important people, they just wore sackcloth
contents.verseText: The people of Nineveh believed in God and announced a time of fasting, and from the least to the most important people, they just wore sackcloth as a sign of contrition.

contents: The king of Nineveh also heard about it and he got down from his throne, took off his robe and put on sackcloth, then sat in a pile of ashes.
contents.verseText: The king of Nineveh also heard about it and he got down from his throne, took off his robe and put on sackcloth, then sat in a pile of ashes.

contents: And he had a statement written out and publicly read throughout Nineveh, saying, “The king and his advisors declare that people and livestock, be it herds or flocks, are prohibited from grazing or eating anything, and even from drinking water.
contents.verseText: And he had a statement written out and publicly read throughout Nineveh, saying, “The king and his advisors declare that people and livestock, be it herds or flocks, are prohibited from grazing or eating anything, and even from drinking water.

contents: Both people and livestock should just wear sacks, and they should use their strength to cry out to God and they should turn away from the evil and violent things they have been doing.
contents.verseText: Both people and livestock should just wear sacks, and they should use their strength to cry out to God and they should turn away from the evil and violent things they have been doing.

contents: And maybe God will turn and change his mind and stop his fierce anger, and maybe we won't die.”
contents.verseText: And maybe God will turn and change his mind and stop his fierce anger, and maybe we won't die.”

contents: And God saw their actions in turning away from their evil ways and he changed his mind about the destruction which he had said he would send to them and he didn't proceed with it.
contents.verseText: And God saw their actions in turning away from their evil ways and he changed his mind about the destruction which he had said he would send to them and he didn't proceed with it.

contents: But Yonah was very upset and the situation made him angry.
contents.verseText: But Yonah was very upset and the situation made him angry.

contents: And he said to Yahweh, “Please Yahweh, wasn't this what I said would happen when I was still in my own country? That's why I fled to Tarshish the first time, because I knew that you are a caring forgiving god, who doesn't get angry quickly; full of kindness and not wanting to cause distress.
contents.verseText: And he said to Yahweh, “Please Yahweh, wasn't this what I said would happen when I was still in my own country? That's why I fled to Tarshish the first time, because I knew that you are a caring forgiving god, who doesn't get angry quickly; full of kindness and not wanting to cause distress.

contents: So therefore Yahweh, please kill me because I'd rather die than live like this.”
contents.verseText: So therefore Yahweh, please kill me because I'd rather die than live like this.”

contents: But Yahweh said, “Do you think it's right to be angry like that?”
contents.verseText: But Yahweh said, “Do you think it's right to be angry like that?”

contents: And Yonah went outside the city to the east and made himself a shelter and sat there in the shade to see what would happen to the city.
contents.verseText: And Yonah went outside the city to the east and made himself a shelter and sat there in the shade to see what would happen to the city.

contents: And Yahweh God commanded a plant and it grew up over Yonah to shade his head and to relieve him from his distress. Yonah was very pleased about the plant.
contents.verseText: And Yahweh God commanded a plant and it grew up over Yonah to shade his head and to relieve him from his distress. Yonah was very pleased about the plant.

contents: Then at dawn the next day God commanded a grub and it attacked the plant which then shrivelled up.
contents.verseText: Then at dawn the next day God commanded a grub and it attacked the plant which then shrivelled up.

contents: And when the sun came up, God sent a hot east wind and the sun beat on Yonah's head. He became faint and asked for his life to end and said, “It's better for me to die than to live.”
contents.verseText: And when the sun came up, God sent a hot east wind and the sun beat on Yonah's head. He became faint and asked for his life to end and said, “It's better for me to die than to live.”
